alert.note: Alert for Cambria; Clearfield; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN CLEARFIELD...SOMERSET AND CAMBRIA COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 354 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles northwest of Indiana to near Latrobe to near Uniontown to near Morgantown. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Johnstown, Somerset, Westmont, Windber, Ebensburg, Belmont, Nanty-Glo, Portage, Northern Cambria, Philipsburg, Geistown, Southmont, Meyersdale, Berlin, Patton, Cresson, Gallitzin, Friedens, Vinco and Loretto. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
